title: Five injured in Southern Expressway accident
byline: Five people, including two foreign women, were injured in an accident on the Southern Expressway near the 168th kilometre post when a luxury van carrying foreign nationals collided with a small lorry travelling ahead of it.

title: Cop suspended over alleged biscuit-sharing with key suspect
byline: A police sergeant has been suspended over alleged inappropriate conduct involving Takshi Nandakumara, a suspect currently being held on a 90-day detention order in connection with the killing of organised criminal Ganemulla Sanjeewa inside the Hulftsdorp court complex.

title: Special leave granted to public officers affected by “Ditwah” cyclone in November
byline: The Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government has announced the granting of special leave to public officers who were unable to report for duty in November 2025 due to the impacts of the “Ditwah” cyclonic storm.

title: No government aid and no officials for Walapane landslide victims, 18 days on
byline: Survivors of a deadly landslide in Napatawala village in Walapane say no government aid has reached them and no officials have visited, 18 days after Cyclone Ditwa triggered the disaster that buried five homes and killed a woman.

title: Over 600 HIV cases in nine months
byline: Sri Lanka faces a worrying upswing in HIV/AIDS cases, with over 600 new infections and 13 deaths reported in the first nine months of 2025.

title: Rob Reiner’s son Nick arrested for murder after director and wife found dead
byline: A son of film director Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner has been arrested and booked on suspicion of murder after the couple were found dead in their Los Angeles home.

title: Attempts at trafficking, exploiting disaster-hit children on the rise
byline: In the wake of Cyclone Ditwah, the Women and Child Affairs Ministry warned of increased attempts by certain elements for child trafficking and exploitation, a spokesperson said.

title: Trump urges Xi to free Hong Kong’s Jimmy Lai
byline: US President Donald Trump says he has asked Chinese leader Xi Jinping to ’’consider’’ releasing Jimmy Lai, the Hong Kong pro-democracy tycoon who was earlier this week found guilty under the city’s controversial national security law.

title: Previously identified landslide risks now subside, NBRO monitoring continues
byline: The National Building Research Organization (NBRO) has confirmed that all previously identified landslide and rockfall risk areas have now subsided.

title: No term tests for grades 6–10, says Education Ministry
byline: The Education Ministry has directed all principals and relevant school officials not to conduct term tests for students in grades 6 to 10 for the third term of the 2025 academic year.

title: Over 1 million birth and marriage certificates destroyed by Cyclone Ditwa
byline: The Registrar General’s Department has confirmed that the birth and marriage registration certificates of over one million people have been destroyed due to the landslides and floods caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Former Minister C. B. Rathnayake granted bail
byline: Former Minister C. B. Rathnayake, who was in remand following his arrest by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), has been granted bail by the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court.

title: Sri Lanka Singers’ Association scoffs rumors on singer Latha Walpola
byline: The Sri Lanka Singers’ Association today scoffed the rumors that are being circulated on social media that popular signer Latha Walpola has passed away.

title: Coconut Board calls for info on damaged coconut trees by December 25
byline: The Coconut Cultivation Board has called on the public to provide information on coconut trees destroyed by Cyclone Ditwah by 25 December.

title: Cyclone Ditwah leaves thousands homeless across Sri Lanka
byline: Cyclone Ditwah has caused widespread destruction in Sri Lanka, completely destroying 6,200 houses and partially damaging 96,545 others, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reported.

title: Dominant Sabalenka wins back-to-back WTA awards
byline: World number one Aryna Sabalenka has been voted the Women’s Tennis Association player of the year for a second successive season.

title: 262 quarries in landslide-prone areas to undergo re-survey: GSMB
byline: The Geological Survey and Mines Bureau (GSMB) has announced plans to conduct a re-scientific survey of 262 quarries operating in areas affected by landslides following Cyclone “Ditwah.”

title: Heavy rains expected in several provinces
byline: Showery conditions prevailing over the Northern and Eastern parts of the island are expected to continue over the next few days under the influence of an easterly wave, the Meteorology Department said.
